title: Threads
text:
The lack of chronological order, of something akin to hashtags and a trending tracker,
hinder my enjoyment of threads. These deficiencies make engagement with others, with the app in general, less than satisfying. Like many, I hope for better in the coming months, given the vast resources of META. Surly, one would hope, that innovation must be happening as I type.

Joe Scutella
Nashville, TN.

title: So lame, only politics and celebrities get any engagement
text:
Really had high hopes for this app, and for a few weeks people seemed so happy to be on it.   Social
Media campaigns from big companies were fresh, clever, and didn’t sound corporate.    People liked each others’ personal posts.    But it just didn’t keep it up…really, it never created any real social interaction.   Celebrities and political posts get all the views,  Just. Like. Twitter.   Our small company gets a lot of real engagement on Twitter (yes a fraction of total engagement) and on Instagram, but nothing on Threads despite a successful Instagram migration.     ie the same audience-on IG they engage, on Threads they don’t.   Some stopped.   It’s a waste of time unless you want to follow the Kardashians and the moronic Trump Biden hate fest.
